main event: Wing Commander TODKILL observed an extremely bright and luminous unidentified object over Terrigal, New South Wales, Australia on January 20, 1953.
interesting points: The object hung motionless for approximately 30 seconds before moving rapidly in a northerly direction for about 10 miles and then immediately disappearing, which took approximately 20-30 seconds.
Throughout its movements, the object appeared to remain at a constant height.
The brilliance of the object was described as comparable to that of a welded arc.
Weather conditions at the time were clear with maximum visibility.

Wing Commander TODKILL is a technical officer well acquainted with aircraft and equipment, and he is of the opinion that the object was a large meteorite based on its observed path, extreme brilliance, rapid movement, and lack of associated sound.
sighted object: an extremely bright and luminous unidentified object
